meanings.definition: To crunch or squeeze something into a compact mass.
meanings.sent1: I scrunch the paper into a ball.
meanings.sent2: She likes to scrunch her socks before putting them on.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to scrunch itself into the tiny box.
meanings.sent4: The old car scrunches through the gravel road.
meanings.sent5: The child's hands scrunch the playdough into different shapes.

meanings.definition: To make a crunching or rustling sound.
meanings.sent1: The leaves scrunch under my feet as I walk.
meanings.sent2: The wind made the branches scrunch against the window.
meanings.sent3: The bag of chips scrunches loudly when opened.
meanings.sent4: The firewood scrunches as it burns in the fireplace.
meanings.sent5: The snow scrunches softly under the sled's runners.

meanings.sent1: I heard the scrunch of leaves as the squirrel ran by.
meanings.sent2: The scrunch of paper echoed in the empty room.
meanings.sent3: The scrunch of footsteps on the gravel path startled the birds.
meanings.sent4: The scrunch of tires on the wet road signaled the arrival of the car.
meanings.sent5: The scrunch of the snack bag being opened caught everyone's attention.
